title: Single slit - ratio of widths - 3rd fringe is 2x

content.question: Light from a laser is directed through a very narrow opening of width <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, resulting in a diffraction pattern on a wall across from the opening. On either side of the central bright fringe in the pattern, the distance from the center of the central fringe to the third point of minimum brightness is a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>. The opening is replaced by another opening of width <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and the third point of minimum brightness is then a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> from the middle of the central bright fringe. What is the ratio <math alttext="a sub 2, end sub, to a sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
